alert.note: Alert for Outagamie (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 5:27PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Outagamie County through 615 PM CDT... At 527 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Black Creek to 8 miles northwest of Appleton. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Outagamie County, including the following locations... Mackville, Twelve Corners, Murphy Corner, Five Corners, Binghamton, Chicago Corners, Oneida, Freedom and Wrightstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
